SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class BatchInsert<T>

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.BatchInsert<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the JavaBeans or records to save to the database
public final class BatchInsert<T> extends Object

BatchInsert specializes in saving large batches of JavaBeans or records to the database. Instances are configured and obtained via a BatchInsertBuilder. A BatchInsert is not underpinned by a PreparedStatement. Yet, it provides just as much protection against SQL injection, as it will process each and every value in the batch using Quoter.quoteValue(). This method ultimately relies on Statement.enquoteLiteral() — in other words, the JDBC driver's own escape-and-quote mechanism.

Batch Insert Variants

Klojang JDBC provides two options for saving batches of beans:

  1. using this class
  2. using SQLInsert.insertBatch()

Functionally these options are equivalent, but they implement the batch insert operation differently, so if performance is important, you should test which one works best for your use case. Otherwise, which one you choose largely is a matter of taste.

See Also:
  • BatchInsertBuilder
  • SQL.insertBatch()

  • Method Details

    • insertBatch

      public void insertBatch(List<T> beans)
      Saves the provided beans or records to the database.
      Parameters:
      beans - the beans to save

    • insertBatchAndGetIDs

      public long[] insertBatchAndGetIDs(List<T> beans)
      Saves the provided beans or records to the database and returns the keys generated by the database. If no keys were generated by the database, a zero-length long[] array is returned.
      Parameters:
      beans - the beans to save
      Returns:
      the keys generated by the database

    • insertBatchAndSetIDs

      public void insertBatchAndSetIDs(String idProperty, List<T> beans)
      Saves the provided beans or records to the database and sets the specified ID property in each of them to the key generated by the database. Obviously, the ID property must be mutable in that case, so <T> must not be a record type.
      Parameters:
      idProperty - the name of the property corresponding to the primary key
      beans - the beans to save
